executive_summary: Portfolio Management industry operators manage asset portfolios for a fee or commission. Over the five years to 2022, the industry has experienced countervailing trends. For the majority of the period, rising assets under management (AUM) as a result of rising asset prices and growing disposable income have increased the base of assets industry operators charge fees on. However, increased investor preference for passive asset management, including through exchange-traded funds (ETFs), has driven expenses charged for the management of assets down during the period.

current_performance.current_performance_point_title: The Portfolio Management industry is largely driven by the assets under management (AUM) of its companies.
current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2022, the value of these assets has grown significantly in response to improving macroeconomic conditions during the majority of the period. Net flows of assets into funds managed by industry operators are driven, in part, by rising employment.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Industry revenue is forecast to grow an annualized 3.1% over the five years to 2027 to $470.9 billion.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: As concerns surrounding the coronavirus dissipate, macroeconomic conditions are expected to improve gradually over the next five years. This improvement is expected to foster an environment that enables asset prices, especially equity prices, to increase during the period.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_title: Average industry profit is anticipated to decrease over the five years to 2027.
future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Investor preference for passive asset management is expected to continue, which will drive expenses charged for the management of assets even lower. Major companies will likely continue to lower fees and increase cost management measures to stay competitive as industry profit flattens during the outlook period.

industry_definition: The industry comprises firms that actively manage assets for clients. Portfolio managers have the authority to make investment decisions and generate revenue through fees that are based on service and portfolio performance. Industry operators manage assets for investment vehicles such as mutual funds, hedge funds and variable insurance products.
key_trends: Shifting consumer preferences have been the dominant driving force of change in the industry during the current period
The mix of products demanded by consumers has been shifting as investors have begun to favor funds with low fee structures
As institutional clients increasingly work with the largest institutions, industry operators compete for the growing number of investors
The technology-driven globalization of the industry will enable portfolio managers to continue diversifying into emerging markets
Larger industry operators will likely adjust to an evolving competitive and regulatory environment
By leveraging new technologies, market entrants can better adapt to changing consumer tastes
Investor preference for passive asset management is expected to continue

market_segmentation.segment_description: Institutional investors include pension funds, endowments, foundations, insurance companies, central banks, sovereign wealth funds and government agencies. This market is anticipated to account for 59.0% of total revenue for the Portfolio Management industry in 2022.

Retail and high-net-worth clients are anticipated to account for the remaining 41.2% of total industry revenue in 2022. Investors in these segments are often served through broker-dealers, banks, insurance companies or other intermediaries.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Large-Cap Equity, Government Fixed Income and Structured Products
products_and_services.product_description: Operators in the Portfolio Management industry invest client money in investment products, giving clients exposure to a range of assets.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Equity Specialties and Fixed Income Products
products_and_services.product_description: Equity specialties are largely considered foreign stocks and small- and mid-cap stocks, while other fixed income products include credit, emerging market and high-yield fixed income products, among others.

products_and_services.product_or_service: Exchange-Traded Funds and Passively Managed Products
products_and_services.product_description: Exchange-traded funds (ETFs) differ from mutual funds because they are primarily managed passively and have their shares traded on exchanges. Funds that track the performance of a particular index, such as the S&P 500, are growing in popularity.

Alternatives include hedge, private-equity, real estate, infrastructure and commodity funds. Hedge funds are pooled investment vehicles whose assets are placed in a range of financial products including derivative products, private equity and debt products (mezzanine debt and mortgage-backed securities).

products_and_services.product_or_service: Solutions Products and Other (Target Date Products and LDIs)
products_and_services.product_description: These products offered by portfolio managers include target date and liability driven investments (LDIs). Target date funds have become more popular with 401(k) investors and largely switch the allocation of investments in the fund from riskier to safer assets as the investor's retirement approaches.

tier_2_suppliers: Internet Service Providers in the US
Wired Telecommunications Carriers in the US
tier_1_buyers: Stock & Commodity Exchanges in the US
Commodity Dealing and Brokerage in the US
tier_2_buyers: Retirement & Pension Plans in the US
Property, Casualty and Direct Insurance in the US
Donations, Grants & Endowment in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Increase in Retirement Savings to Invest
demand_determinants.determinant_description: The growing savings of emerging countries is also adding to the level of assets under management (AUM) globally, through both individuals and sovereign wealth funds.

Volatility in debt, equity and fixed-income markets negatively affects the flow of funds into managed investments. Movements in interest rates will affect the flow of funds into investment portfolios, the total funds under management and the level of activity of portfolio managers.

Demand for portfolio management services is also largely determined by the historical performance of portfolio managers and branding. Despite constant disclaimers that past performance is not indicative of future result, they do affect the operator's reputation and the subsequent flow of funds received for investment purposes.

international_trade_points.trade_description: Given the service-based nature of the Portfolio Management industry, exports and imports are not applicable. However, industry operators experience intense competition from foreign-owned portfolio managers and domestic companies have been increasingly subject to global macroeconomic trends.

business_locations.location_description: The Mid-Atlantic region is estimated to account for 14.3% of total establishments in the Portfolio Management industry. The region is the most important geographic segment for investment bankers and securities dealers, whom industry operators attract assets from.

The West region is estimated to account for 16.4% of total industry establishments. The high number of industry establishments in the West can be explained by its densely-populated cities and advanced capital markets.

The Southeast region is estimated to account for 20.8% of total industry establishments. The high concentration of establishments in this region is attributed to its substantial population levels and corporate business activities.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The SEC administers and enforces the federal securities laws to protect investors and maintain fair, honest and efficient securities markets. The SEC regulates operators in the Portfolio Management industry under various acts.
The Investment Company Act regulates the structure and operations of the financial services sector, requiring investment companies to register with the SEC.
The act requires federal registration of all public offerings of securities and provides all prospective investors with a current prospectus.
The act empowers the SEC with broad authority over all aspects of the securities sector, including regulating broker-dealers and self-regulatory organizations.
The Investment Advisers Act of 1940 requires federal registration of all investment advisers and contains various antifraud provisions.

regulations_points.regulation_title: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform & Consumer Protection Act
regulations_points.regulation_description: The Dodd-Frank Act and its Volcker Rule provision aim to identify financial systemic risks and prevent future crises by restricting proprietary trading and fund ownership by commercial banks.
The Fiduciary Rule expands the definition of 'investment fiduciary advice', increasing scrutiny and compliance costs for professionals working with retirement plans.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The industry assistance level is low and steady.
The regulation level is heavy and increasing.
The globalization level is high and increasing.
The competition level is high and increasing.
The capital intensity level is low.

factors_decreased_barrier: The outsourcing of trading, data collection and back-office infrastructure keep capital costs in check.
The ability for funds of any size to market and distribute their investment products to consumers worldwide has grown steadily.

basis_points.basis_description: Within the Portfolio Management industry, portfolio managers compete primarily based on their investment performance and costs. Portfolio managers may be employed directly by a fund or be a fund sponsor themselves. Alternatively, a collective investment vehicle may contract out the portfolio management services to a third-party investment manager.

The Portfolio Management industry spans a range of financial institutions, with portfolio management provided by asset management companies, hedge funds, investment banks, insurance companies and brokerage companies. In recent years, industry operators have experienced an increasing amount of competition from nontraditional asset managers.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The Portfolio Management industry operates with a low level of market share concentration. The top four companies combined are estimated to account for 7.7% of total industry revenue in 2022.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Labor costs represent the largest expenditures
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Labor costs represent the largest expenditures for industry operators, accounting for an estimated 33.2% of industry revenue in 2022.
Over the five years to 2022, industry operators have increased its consumption of cost-saving technology, such as those used for bookkeeping and administrative purposes, to save time and money.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Depreciation expenses increased due to technology investments
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: As operators have invested more in various technological products to help streamline some of its processes, depreciation expenses have increased during the current period to comprise 1.1% of industry revenue in 2022.
Industry operators do not have extensive marketing strategies, as they tend to prefer to let its historical performance attract new clients.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Rent expenses declined due to outsourcing
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Rent expenses share of industry revenue have slightly declined during the current period, largely as a result of outsourcing certain middle and back-office tasks.
Since operators only need to heat and cool their establishments, utility expenses are not a large part of their cost structure.

cost_factors.cost_factor_title: Other costs include administration, underwriting and distribution
cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Moreover, administration, underwriting and distribution expenses also account for a significant portion of total industry revenue.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_title: Low capital investment relative to wages
capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: In 2022, IBISWorld estimates that for every $1.00 spent on wages, the industry will allocate $0.03 to capital investment.
Capital-intensive IT functions, such as trading and asset services, are largely outsourced to securities brokers and custodian banks.
IT outsourcing to these third parties has enabled the industry to transition from a fixed to a variable cost structure, which enables industry players to keep profit high.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Volatility depends on fees and assets under management
volatility_points.volatility_description: Volatility primarily depends on any aggregate changes in fees for industry operators and assets under management (AUM), which in turn rely on the current macroeconomic climate and industry-specific competitive landscape.

volatility_points.volatility_title: Increasing share of low-fee products reduces volatility
volatility_points.volatility_description: During the current period, an increasing share of products requires low base and performance fees, which diminishes and smooths out volatility.
The decline in the S&P 500 in 2018 created some revenue volatility along with other market fluctuations.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Use of technology to improve efficiency and risk management
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Industry operators use technology to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of services distribution and risk management.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Transition towards telecommunication and IT services
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Over the past two decades, the financial services sector has rapidly transitioned toward a reliance on telecommunication services, information technologies and electronic distribution technologies.
Asset managers use portfolio management solutions to invest a fund's assets, implement investment strategies and manage day-to-day trading.

technological_change_points.technological_change_title: Internet enables pricing and performance comparisons
technological_change_points.technological_change_description: The internet gives consumers the ability to quickly compare pricing and product performance between different industry companies.
Marketing products to new investors is anticipated to require more frequent and detailed data dissemination, both because of regulation and consumer demand.

FAQs.question: How do you emphasize the value of your company's services?
FAQs.answer: Portfolio managers emphasize their value by demonstrating over a long period of time they are a trustworthy asset manager, with a proven track record of generating returns for their clients.

FAQs.question: What media channels are you using to attract consumers and investors, if any?
FAQs.answer: Portfolio managers, especially those that offer low-cost ETFs, have been particularly fond of using the internet to advertise to would-be customers in recent years.

FAQs.question: What international operations do you conduct and how could benefit from increasing your international reach?
FAQs.answer: Since portfolio managers can manage money from anywhere, appreciation of assets globally leads portfolio managers with more assets to manage. Portfolio managers with broader international portfolios were able to minimize some risk during the COVID-19 pandemic, as some countries responses to the pandemic, and their subsequent recoveries, has proved to be faster than others.

FAQs.question: What is your company doing to reduce costs?
FAQs.answer: Portfolio managers have been outsourcing some mid- and back-office operations in recent years to cut labor expenses.

FAQs.question: How have you taken advantage of rising internet and mobile-internet penetration into the financial services industry?
FAQs.answer: Portfolio managers have benefited from increased marketing to target demographics mobile-internet penetration has afforded them. As more services have been conducted online during the COVID-19 pandemic, this has led the total audience operators adds can reach to increase.

FAQs.question: To what extent are your processes automated and how do you plan on investing in automation over the coming years?
FAQs.answer: Automation of mid- and back-office procedures have become increasingly automated in recent years and are expected to continue to be automated in the future.

FAQs.question: Have there been any other legislative measures enacted that have affected your business?
FAQs.answer: Portfolio managers have been forced to disclose more information to investors, which has led their regulatory expenses to increase. These sorts of regulations have been increasing in recent years and are likely to continue from sources like the Consumer Financial Protection Bureau and the Securities and Exchanges Commission.

FAQs.question: How have the increased capital requirements under Basel III affected operations?
FAQs.answer: Since portfolio managers do not extend loans to individuals or businesses, Basel III does not affect them.

FAQs.question: Do you have enough capital reserved to be able to invest in new technology/software as soon as it becomes available?
FAQs.answer: Licenses for new software and technology needed by portfolio managers is generally inexpensive when spread across the entirety of the business. Additionally, portfolio management companies were well capitalized in 2020.

FAQs.question: How does your profit margin compare to those of your competitors?
FAQs.answer: Profit margins vary widely between portfolio managers based upon the clients they service and the type of funds they operate. Collectively, operators in the industry were hurt from declining bond yields in 2020 as a result of lower interest rates stemming from the Federal Funds Rate being lowered to the zero-bound range by the Federal Reserve. Conversely, investment in domestic equities likely performed well in the second-half of the year, as indexes recovered from their pandemic-lows.

FAQs.question: How often does your distribution network supply you with referrals? What steps can you take to increase the size of your distribution network?
FAQs.answer: A large distribution network is crucial for a firm's expansion. Moreover, portfolio managers can benefit from referrals from investment bankers and other financial services providers included in their distribution network. In recent years, merger and acquisition activity among portfolio managers has continued to facilitate the expansion of these distribution networks.

FAQs.question: How do you measure the popularity of your brand? How do you maintain and enhance your reputation in the market?
FAQs.answer: Reputation is also affected through strong brand names, the quality and availability of research reports and the quality of customer service. Consumers tend to have a higher degree of trust in brand name financial institution, who have weather economic turbulence in the past, during times of similar unrest, such as that seen during the COVID-19 pandemic.

FAQs.question: How do you ensure that your portfolio managers have the appropriate qualifications? How do you reward portfolio managers that perform well?
FAQs.answer: Intelligent and experienced portfolio managers are highly sought after to manage assets. Most portfolio managers have graduate degrees in economics or finance and additional professional designations such as the Chartered Financial Analyst.

FAQs.question: How can you cater to individuals with less discretionary income to invest? How can you adapt as the prime rate increases?
FAQs.answer: The prime rate represents the interest rate charged by banks to their most credit-worthy clients. As this rate increases, it represents a growing cost of borrowing for individuals and businesses.

FAQs.question: How have current share prices affected your company?
FAQs.answer: Higher share prices drive up industry assets under management and corresponding management and performance fees on these assets. In 2020, there was considerable volatility in financial markets at the onset of the COVID-19 pandemic which led the value of the S&P 500 to plummet. However, increased understanding of the pandemic, as well as fiscal stimulus, helped lead the value of the S&P 500 to recover its losses from earlier in the year and end 2020 with gains. The value of the S&P 500 is also expected to continue to grow in 2022, as economic activity once again picks up as concerns surrounding the pandemic dissipate.

FAQs.question: How can you take advantage when share prices increase?
FAQs.answer: Higher share prices drive up industry assets under management and corresponding management and performance fees on these assets.

FAQs.question: How can you take advantage of an increase in per capita disposable income? Are any of your services more heavily affected by fluctuations in disposable income levels?
FAQs.answer: The share of discretionary income indicates the amount of money that is available to be invested. While some consumers per capita disposable income was diminished as a result of job losses during the COVID-19 pandemic, government stimulus helped offset some of these losses.
